Text.Value: *The very air around you seems to quiver and cool, as if disturbed by some presence - an invisible, formless, welcoming presence.*
As I knew you would. You have been loyal and steadfast, even when you doubted yourself. Now listen carefully:
Lady Shar...? Is that you?
Lady Shar...?
You know me, just as I know you, Shadowheart. I am with you always - in your thoughts, your deeds, in your dreams.
Who are you? Show yourself!
I'm listening.
Your thoughts? Then it shouldn't be too hard to find a way out.
Right. Holler if you ever get too lost, all right? I'll help you find your way out.
Oh to peek into the maze of your mind.
Hmm, if you say so. I hope at least the thoughts are pleasant.
Mm. Who am I to deny you a little detour?
Well, do let me know if I should send in a search party.
Keep focused - this is hardly the place for daydreaming.
Lady Shar...?
It's nothing. I just got lost in my own thoughts.
Peace, Shadowheart. You know who it is that speaks to you. I wish you no harm. I wish only to offer my embrace.
Child.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart glances around in surprise at the disembodied voice speaking to her.

Text.Value: Quiet - this is some trick. The parasite, toying with my mind. Stop it.
Already, you have the Spear of Night. Wield it to make the sacrifice.
Tense for battle.
Shar. She spoke to me. I have to find a sacred spear and make a sacrifice in her name.
Spill all the strange blood you need. But take care where you point this so-called 'sacred spear'.
Wow. All right. That's a lot to take in. And I'm not sure it sounds like the Shadowheart I know. Think hard before you do something you can't take back.
Well, that sounds fun. As long as no one present needs to be the sacrifice.
Has Shar not already taken enough from these lands, without demanding a sacrifice as well? Be careful what your faith asks of you.
Sacrifice. Hells - have we not witnessed enough?
A sacrifice? There's little to offer here but bones and dust. Let's keep going.
I doubt you'll find much to sacrifice in this place. Let's keep focused.
Say nothing.
I am here for you. And I hope you are here for me.
Quiet - this is some trick. The parasite, toying with my mind. Stop it.
Mysterious voices, Shadowheart? Or just a newfound interest in self-reflection?
Yoo-hoo. You all right in there?
You're muttering to yourself, dear. Who's better conversation than yours truly?
You seem to be mumbling to yourself - aren't I enough company for you?
Spill the magic beans, Shadowheart. Who are you talking to?
Shadowheart? Gold for your thoughts?
Why are you muttering to yourself?
I won't fail you, my Lady.
Indeed. Welcome. It has been a long road to bring you back to me. But there is more I need of you. Listen closely:
Like the Dark Justiciars of old, you must journey to my innermost sanctum and make a sacrifice in my name. You will become my Voice made flesh, to command all who bow to me.
You are wise to show caution, but this is nothing to do with the foulness lurking in your head. I am real, and I am here for you. Now listen carefully:
Child.
Seek out the library. It houses more than just knowledge. Find the Spear of Night. Wield it to make your sacrifice.
Tense for battle.
You keep your silence, your composure - good. This is why I come to you alone, Shadowheart. Only you can help me.
Who are you? Show yourself!
I'm listening.
This is my sacred proving ground. This is where you shall show me just how much you love me. Then I can embrace you, elevate you, reveal to you your true purpose.
You are ready. You were born for this. Now, forth - make me proud.
*The very air around you seems to quiver and cool, as if disturbed by some presence - an invisible, formless, welcoming presence.*
Say nothing.

Synopsis: When Shadowheart enters the Shar Temple for the first time Shar speaks to her. Shar wants Shadowheart to find the Spear of Night and use it to kill Nightsong. Shar will tell Shadowheart where to find the spear.
